title.narrative: Protection of Sudanese Refugees and South Sudanese Children in South Sudan

description.narrative: Objective 1: At risk Sudanese and S. Sudanese children have their protection concerns addressed through community-based support systems Outcome 1.1: Identified vulnerable children in Ajuong Thok receive appropriate assistance to meet their immediate needs. Outcome 1.2: At risk children engage in CFS centers activities in Ajuong Thok and Maban. Outcome 1.3: Community members promote protection for refugee and host community children in Ajuong Thok, Yusuf Batil, Kaya, and Gendrassa. Objective 2: Sudanese and South Sudanese children receive quality basic education Outcome 2.1: Pre-primary and primary students have improved learning environments in schools in the Maban camps. Objective 3: Sudanese and South Sudanese youth and adults have life and vocational skills Outcome 3.1: Youth in Yusuf Batil, Gendrassa and Kaya receive non-formal education and vocational training.

With support from the U.S. Department of State Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration (PRM), LWR and LWF/South Sudan are improving the protection, resilience and psychosocial well-being of children in Ajuong Thok Camp, in Unity State, as well as Maban, in Upper Nile State, South Sudan. The Protection of Sudanese Refugee and South Sudanese Children in South Sudan project focuses on meeting the immediate protection concerns of vulnerable boys and girls. In addition, LWR and LWF/South Sudan are contributing to the establishment of community-based structures and systems that identify, prevent, mitigate and respond to the protection concerns of vulnerable children on an on-going basis.
The goal of the project is to improve the protection, education, and livelihoods of children, youth, and adults in Ajuong Thok, Yusuf Batil, Gendrassa, and Kaya camps and host communities.
